page.title: 19GREEN BELT LAND UNDER THREAT
page.content:
The villages of Harmondsworth and Sipson are within London's Green Belt (To stop London expanding any further) which has helped to protect them from change. Much of the land is still used for farming and even where gravel extraction has taken place, the companies have returned the land to farming after use.
The biggest influence has been the growth of Heathrow Airport. There has been pressure from deveolpers to build hotels, wharehoses and airport offices. The area has for many years been a centre of communications with the Great Western Railway and the M4 Motorway attracting many small industries to the areas of West Drayton and Yiewsly. It is hoped that existing legislation and local pressure will preserve the landscape.
